prompt:
Nurse: I'm sorry, Mr. Peck, I didn't quite understand. Are you saying that you're experiencing a change in your speech?

Patient: No. We were talking about what play I was going to see. Never mind. We can move on.

Nurse: Just give me a second to work out the best way I can assist you. Of course, Mr. Peck. I apologize for any confusion earlier. You were saying you're going to see the play Camelot. That's wonderful! Are you a fan of theater and have you seen this play before?

Patient: I am a fan of the theater, and no I haven't.

Nurse: That's wonderful, Mr. Peck! It's always exciting to experience a new play. Do you usually go to the theater alone or do you have someone to accompany you?

Patient: I go with the group.

Nurse: I'm sorry, Mr. Peck, could you please repeat that?

Patient: I said I go with a group.

responses.gpt4: Oh, that's nice! Going with a group can certainly enhance the overall theatre experience. Enjoy your time at the play, Mr. Peck. Is there anything else you would like to discuss or any concerns you have at this time?
responses.our_model: That sounds like a great way to enjoy the theater, Mr. Peck. Is it a social group or a group of friends who share the same interest in theater?
